caption.p: Phylogenetic Methods Used in the PANGEA Phylodynamic Methods Comparison Exercise.

tr.th: Simulated Data Used To Inform Inference

tr.td: C. Weis, G.E. Leventhal, D. Kühnert, D.A. Rasmussen, T. Stadler
Birth–death skyline method with sampled ancestors

Stochastic birth–death model with sampled ancestors to estimate incidence and incidence reductions, and multi-type birth death model corresponding to two stages of infection to estimate the proportion of early transmissions. Time trends in parameters were modeled with serial time intervals during which parameters were assumed constant. Viral introductions were not modeled
All sequences and full trees to estimate birth–death parameters; cross-sectional survey data
http://beast2.org/ (last accessed October 14, 2016) using add-ons bdsky, SA, bdmm
B. Dearlove, M. Hossain, S. Frost
Standard SI, SIS and SIR models were averaged. Model parameters did not change over time. Viral introductions were not modeled.
http://beast.bio.ed.ac.uk/ (last accessed October 14, 2016) using XML specification described in ( Dearlove and Wilson 2013)
E. Volz, M. Hossain, S. Frost

Deterministic compartment model stratified by gender, disease progression, diagnosis and treatment status, risk behavior. Time trends in baseline transmission rates were modeled with 4-parameter generalized logistic function. Diagnosis and treatment uptake rates changed at intervention start. Viral introductions were modeled with a source deme.
All sequences and sub-trees including all internal nodes 30 before the last sample; cross-sectional survey data; and gender and CD4 count at time of diagnosis for Regional datasets.
C. Colijn, M. Kendall, G. Plazotta, X. Didelot
Stochastic generalized branching model with generation time modeled to represent three infection stages. Model parameters did not change over time. Viral introductions were not modeled.
All sequences and full trees on village datasets; sequences in trees with at least 80 tips on regional datasets.
https://github.com/xavierdidelot/TransPhylo (last accessed October 14, 2016) PANGEA release available from authors
A. Poon, J. Joy, R. Liang

Deterministic compartment model stratified by infection status, three stages of infection, and risk behavior. Model parameters did not change over time. Viral introductions were modeled with a source deme.
https://github.com/ArtPoon/kamphir (last accessed October 14, 2016) PANGEA release available from authors
